concise_definition: v. 错过, 未击中, 遗漏, 想念

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to hit, reach, or catch something intended, often due to inaccuracy or bad timing.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未能击中、触及或抓住本应击中或抓住的事物，通常因不准确或时机不当所致。
definitions.example_en: He missed the target by just a few inches.
definitions.example_cn: 他离目标只差了几英寸。

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to attend, be present for, or participate in something scheduled or expected.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未能出席、到场或参与本应参加的安排或活动。
definitions.example_en: She missed the meeting because she was stuck in traffic.
definitions.example_cn: 她因为堵车错过了会议。

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to notice, understand, or recognize something important or obvious.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未能注意到、理解或识别出重要或显而易见的事物。
definitions.example_en: You missed the main point of his argument.
definitions.example_cn: 你没抓住他论点的核心。

definitions.explanation_en: To feel a strong sense of longing or sadness because someone or something is absent.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因某人或某物的缺席而感到强烈的思念或悲伤。
definitions.example_en: I missed my grandmother so much after she moved away.
definitions.example_cn: 祖母搬走后，我非常想念她。

comparison.analysis: “Failed” (失败) 强调未能达成目标或完成任务，通常带有负面评价，侧重结果的失败。而 “missed” 更侧重于“错过”某个具体的机会、事件或目标，不一定意味着整体失败，可能只是偶然或无意的遗漏。
“Overlooked” (忽视) 指因疏忽或注意力不足而未注意到某事物，常带有主观责任（如本应看到却没看到）。“Missed” 可以是无意的，也可以是客观上未能赶上（如错过火车），范围更广，不必然包含疏忽的意味。
“Lost” (丢失) 强调某物或某人已不可找回，常指永久性或长时间的失去，如丢失钥匙、失去亲人。“Missed” 更强调暂时的缺席或未参与，且常伴随情感上的思念，如想念某人，但对方仍存在。
